description: Ms. codex. Title from leaf 1a, by a later hand. Physical description: 6 lines per page; written in large naskh in black on glazed, laid European paper. Catchwords; extensive interlinear and marginal notes. Occasional staining, smudging, and repairs. Origin: 1232 H [1816 or 1817], by Muḥammad Ḥusayn ibn Ḥājjī Mīrzā Aḥmad al-Muṣāḥibī al-Nāʼīnī (leaf 117a). Incipit: ابهى اصل ىبتني علىه الخطاب واولى قول فضل ينتمي اليه اولو الالباب
author: ʻĀmilī, Bahāʼ al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Ḥusayn, 1547-1621
extent: 118 leaves : paper ; 185 x 100 (119 x 52) mm bound to 187 x 104 mm
title: Zubdat al-uṣūl
provenance: Two owners' notes and stamps on leaf 2a. Three owners' stamps on leaf 117a.
creator: عاملي، بهاء الدين محمد بن حسين، 1547-1621
subject: Islamic law—Interpretation and construction—Early works to 1800
binding note: Stiffened brown leather with blind-stamped fillets; brown leather doublures.
member of collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
